docs.snippet: While Washington frets over an AT&T-Time Warner merger, Silicon Valley giants have taken over the media business.

headline.print_headline: Who Runs  the Media?  Not Us
headline.main: Forget AT&T. The Real Monopolies Are Google and Facebook.

docs.snippet: It’s dangerous to promise that a social network will vet what’s true.
Mark Zuckerberg took a page from Google’s playbook to keep control of his company while he gives a majority of his stake away. But Facebook investors may have a lever.

headline.print_headline: A Potential Hitch in Zuckerberg’s Stock Plan for Facebook
headline.main: A Potential Hitch in Zuckerberg’s Stock Plan for Facebook

docs.abstract: Steven Davidoff Solomon Deal Professor column observes that Mark Zuckerberg is attempting to give majority of his stake in Facebook away while still keeping control of the company by following strategy used by Google's founders; notes shareholders seeking to stop his plan in court may have some leverage since their lawyers obtained texts showing Marc Andreessen coaching Zuckerberg on this plan.

docs.snippet: Facebook said on Thursday that it had begun introducing a series of experiments to limit misinformation and false articles on its site.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Moves to Limit Tide of Fake News on Its Network
headline.main: Facebook Mounts Effort to Limit Tide of Fake News

docs.snippet: The social network, which has dealt with similar issues in recent months, is fixing three of its ad-measurement devices after inaccuracies were found.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Reports Issues With Ad-Counting Tools
headline.main: Facebook Reports New Issues With Ad-Counting Tools

docs.snippet: From fake news to a censorship tool to a slow draw on removing hate speech, the social media giant is struggling to deal with the ethics of its business.

headline.main: Daily Report: Facebook Spends a Month Behind the Woodshed

docs.snippet: What you do online can help elect a president.

headline.print_headline: The Secret Agenda of a Facebook Quiz
headline.main: Cambridge Analytica and the Secret Agenda of a Facebook Quiz

docs.snippet: The charges come amid growing tension between the social media company and Europe’s policy makers over how it dominates much of the region’s digital world.

headline.print_headline: European Officials Say Facebook Misled Them About WhatsApp
headline.main: European Officials Accuse Facebook of Misleading Them on WhatsApp Deal

docs.snippet: The social network’s efforts to placate German authorities provide a case study for its moves to combat fake news and hate speech online worldwide.

headline.main: Facebook Runs Up Against German Hate Speech Laws

docs.snippet: China is a tempting market for Facebook, which has been banned there since 2009. But to get in, the social network may have to compromise on its mission.

headline.main: Daily Report: Facebook Courts China With Censoring Software
